framework

Class Constraint

  • java.lang.Object
    • framework.Constraint
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryConstraint, BooleanConstraint, DummyConstraint, MetaConstraint, MultiConstraint

    public abstract class Constraint
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    This class is used to represent n-ary constraints in the MetaCSP framework. The scope of a constraint is the set of all Variables involved in the constraint. An important subclass is BinaryConstraint, which provides support for constraints whose scope has size two.
    Author:
    Federico Pecora
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getEdgeLabel

        public abstract java.lang.String getEdgeLabel()
        Every Constraint should implement this method - its value is what is drawn by the ConstraintNetwork rendering methods.

      • getScope

        public Variable[] getScope()
        Returns the scope of this Constraint.
        Returns:
        the scope of this Constraint (an array of size 2 if this is a BinaryConstraint).

      • isEquivalent

        public abstract boolean isEquivalent(Constraint c)
        Method for assessing the "equivalence" between two constraints. This is not used for lookups nor comparisons (hence, it is not the equals method).
        Parameters:
        c - The Constraint to compare against.
        Returns:
        true iff the two constraints are considered to be equivalent.
